Project: SSP - Shared Services Platform 
SSP Shared Services Platform is a Service bus, which resides between the Consumers and Providers. This Layer provides a solution to the communication gap between different kinds of Providers and Consumers. SSP does acts as a mediator between the Providers and Consumers by doing the necessary Message transformations as per the expected formats of Providers/Consumers. 
SSP has a portal, which is used by both Providers and Consumers. Providers use the portal to register their web services. And Consumers can consume the web services, which are registered by Providers. Here SSP also provides a facility to mention rules To call their Services , which are set by the providers at the time of registration. Consumers have to adhere to the rules, which are mandated by the providers in order to utilize the services. 
SSP Supports all formats of calls - SOAP, REST, XML & JAVA . Despite of the format of the provider consumer can utilize the service.

Project Name: MPA Manage Product Availability 
Manage Product Availability is a capability developed on Convergent operations platform which is a part of ADLI (Access Design Layer Interface) Manage Product Availability is a generic interface being consumed by many upstream systems where customer can place the orders for provisioning. All the orders placed by customer will initially reaches MPA for Availability check for the provision check. Once the request reaches, MPA will make different downstream/backend calls and collects various information about the Directory Number/Address or whichever passed in the MPA request. And basing on the information retrieved from backend responses MPA decides the responses to the upstream systems. 
MPA responds to the upstream system in three different RAG status which is RED, AMBER & GREEN. Basing on the MPA response customer decides he can be provisioned with the product or not. 
MPA will receive request with many parameters but MPA will mainly consider two parameters Request Type & Specification Category to initiate/decide the backend calls. There will be many combinations of Request Types with different Specification Categories will reach MPA and where MPA needs to decide the invocation of the flows for each and every combination. So, MPA was implemented Spring IOC to invoke the flows basing on the different parameters. 
In MPA the downstream/backend calls will be done via HTTP, JMS & Procedure calls. MPA has also implemented Spring Injection to invoke JMS calls, JDBC beans factory for invoking DB calls and all remaining calls will be SOAP over HTTP calls invoked via web-service. 
There are three instances of MPA developed across different stacks Wholesale, Retail & Global Services to serve BT on all the Line of businesses.

• Playing a key role in code development and developer testing.

• The component was developed on JDK 1.5 with Oracle 10g & Weblogic 9.1. Now I am playing a key role in migrating the component to the higher versions JDK1.6 with Oracle 11.2.0 & Weblogic 10

Supplemental data reporting (SDR) team receives data from more than 20 vendors on a monthly basis. These data needs to be extracted, transformed & loaded to the appropriate data warehousing tables. As soon as the load process is 
 
complete, the data needs to be profiled to understand the Source and destination data. The profiling process will result in building remediation tables for the data that missed out both at the source as well as at the destination level. These tables then go to the upper management as reports to help them decide how to manage the bad data. 
 
Responsibilities: 
➢ Create Unix shell scripts to extract the files from the vendors stored in servers. 
➢ Create BTEQ, Fast load or Mload scripts based on need to manipulate the data from the vendor to load them to Teradata.

➢ Use the DQS profiling tool to profile the data at the source level to understand the nature of the data from different vendors including file formats, fields & raw data. 
➢ Profile the data at the destination level to understand how it has been transformed to fit the destination tables & structures. 
➢ Write SQL code to create remediation tables for the missing data at source & destination. 
➢ Create Stored procedures for the SQL code so these can be re-used at a later point if needed.

Position Title: Software Developer 
 
Description: Prepaid cards provide consumers, businesses and governments with the efficiency, security and flexibility of digital payments through a non-credit payment option. FSV Prepaid Card web portal is a suite of portal applications built to manage the card-program and cardholder over web and accessing all financial information over web. With the use of Liferay (JSR 168 and 286) portal framework, a multi-tenant portal infrastructure was developed to support multiple clients across the prepaid card industry. Below list of inbuilt Liferay feature were extensively used in the project:- 
1. Web Content, Structure and Template 
2. Velocity script, 
3. Role and Permissions, 
4. Liferay Hooks, 
5. Liferay Themes, 
6. Liferay Page layout, and 
7. Creating organization and site via control panel 
 
I had used Spring MVC to generate the custom portlets and iBatis layer to integrate with Oracle Database. On the UI side, we had used JQuery and Javascript to develop rich web interfaces. 
 
The two major Portal applications are – Client Portal and Cardholder Portal.  
 
Client Portal Applications – These suites of application are used by client and US bank to administrate and manage their cardholders. Client users can use these applications to search the cardholder, order temporary cards, funds transfer, cardholder registration, setting up the programs and program transaction limits, etc. These applications are very critical for business since they provide the online capacity to client and US Bank customer service center to load money to cardholder accounts. There are total 6 client portal websites used by different clients. 
 
Cardholder Portal Applications – These suites of application are used by cardholders to access their prepaid card account. After registration and login into the website, cardholders can check their balance, setup alerts, card to card transfers, card to bank transfer, account setting, card activities and monthly statements. There are total 89 cardholder portal websites used by different clients.

• Security fixes to achieve the PCI security standards – supporting WhiteHat & OWASP scans and Sunera (Mobile security scan). 
• Integrating the mailing system with Exact Target using web-services.  
• Integrating the CIP (require by PATRIOT Act) with Experian credit rating system.

Description 
Global Authorization network: 
When a card member swipes card in any point of service (terminals), GAN is the first system to be hit with Transaction trace. Primary responsibility of the system is to Authorize incoming trace, capture the details in to database and send it to Credit Authorization system (CAS) where actual processing of transaction happens. GAN will be getting back response from CAS and this will be redirected to Point of service terminals. GAN even acts as standby to CAS in its absence. 
This is developed using JAVA J2EE Spring for the presentation and business logic layers and uses Oracle and various mainframe databases for data storage.

Designing Information as a By-product

https://www.researchgate.net/publication/301699306_Designing_Information_as_a_By-product

April 2016

Much of IS design theory makes an assumption that if data is required by data consumers , it needs to be captured by the information systems (IS) explicitly and directly. With the pervasiveness of direct representation in IS development and research, academia has offered little support for cases where not all data elements required by data consumers are collected and stored directly. With the explosive proliferation of business analytics, it is becoming increasingly effective to mine existing data sources for unanticipated and novel insights. We developed and implemented GroceryBer-an online prototype for the crowd-sourcing grocery delivery service in which we intentionally designed information as a by-product of the grocery delivery process.

Publikationen

Worse Than Alone

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Worse_Than_Alone

10. März 2009

The Number Twelve Looks Like You has a sound that matches their complex name. Like fellow Jersey boys Dillinger Escape Plan, their music is furiously experimental mathcore--time signatures and polyrythms careening wildly in a kind of chaotic discipline. It's certainly not all crazed screaming; "Marvin's Jungle" is gently off-kilter and melodic, more DC post-hardcore than metal, until it explodes into machine-gun drums and thrash guitars, and "The League of Endangered Oddities" features melodic vocals and shifting cascades of guitar texture. More than anything, however, WORSE THAN ALONE aims to rip heads off of shoulders with neck-snapping shifts in tempo.

Mongrel

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mongrel_(The_Number_Twelve_Looks_Like_You_album)

19. Juni 2007

On Mongrel, the Number 12 have taken the grindcore/metal sound they've crafted over their last few releases and added new elements. The result is something not as chaotic and hellish, but just as intense and much smarter than anything else they've put out. It also feels less straightforward than their other material. Gone are the power chords and metal riffs of their previous work. The guitars never let down; the riffs are always interesting. The band experiments with several styles throughout the album, blending them all flawlessly. I'm sure the feel of the record stems from Casey Bates' (Fear Before the March of Flames' The Always Open Mouth, Portugual. The Man, Gatsbys American Dream) production.

Here At The End Of All Things

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Here_at_the_End_of_All_Things

17. Juni 2008

This DVD/CD release captures a sold out live performance at the School Of Rock in East Hackensack, NJ. The package includes a live multi-angle video performance from the "Mongrel" tour, music videos from past releases, an exclusive interview, and a full audio CD filled with tracks from the featured live show, three dance remixes, a special tribute to Number 12 by veteran J. Gale Kilgore, and more. This release brings you to the front row, translating to DVD/CD the crashing grind-core, metal, punk, indie, prog, and experimental sounds of The Number Twelve's live performances.

Changepoint is a single, integrated system that effectively tracks a company's core business processes from start to finish, providing real-time access to accurate, business-critical data. Changepoint automates and integrates key business processes and gives access to unprecedented views into the distribution of effort and cost of service delivery. Management gains greater control to drive accountability at all levels of the organization to ensure investments support business priorities and increase the quality and efficiency of service delivery. 
Changepoint effectively tracks an account's engagements from inception to completion. Users can set up profiles for each of their accounts and set up several engagements for each customer. 
Changepoint has three main applications: Changepoint Enterprise, System Manager and Report Designer. Within an organization, most users require only the Changepoint Enterprise application. Typically, only those employees who are responsible for system set up or who perform reporting duties require the System Manager or Report Designer applications.

2. Development and Unit Testing. 
3. Designing and implementation of user interfaces.

PROJECT DESCRIPTION: 
The Access Optimization (AO) project has been implemented by ACELA to integrate several of Verizon's Networks provisioning systems like, NetPro, F&E, Cameo etc. The Access Optimization application accepts orders from NetPro, F&E and COMS, stores the order in the ICS transient database, and then interacts with: 
 
• The CAMEO application, which determine the optimal path to provision the order. During the determination of the optimal path, CAMEO invokes the CFA Validation routine of the AO application. The CFA Validation routine in turn interacts with F&E, NetPro, TCOMS and Symphony to determine circuit availability. 
• The Symphony application to do LEC Address Validation. 
Once A & B are complete, the AO application returns the processed order information back to the originating system. AO application also processes requests from the PSG to do Path Selection, CFA Validation and LEC Address Validation. These interfaces have been developed using WebSphere Business Integration (WBI) Interchange Server (ICS). It includes development of Business Objects, Data Handlers, Maps, Collaboration and configuring connectors, relationships and Database Connection Pools.

Description: WSS is the confirmation and settlement system for mainly Money Markets and Emerging markets of Deutsche Bank. WSS follows a STP model.
